Description: Corroded copper alloy wedge or short chisel, with a flattened and rounded cutting edge, and a round top irregularly flared by hammering.
Curator's comments: One of the bronze "chisels" of "various shapes" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 77 § 76, pl. xxxix, 27
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 77 § 76, pl. xxxix, 27)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.47, p.76, p.184, pl.26)
